Sample program

Packages 
Package Description
com.theta360.sample.v2
Root package for sample program
com.theta360.sample.v2.glview
Package that stores the view class for photo drawing used in OpenGL of the Android sample programs
com.theta360.sample.v2.glview.model
Package in which OpenGL objects used by glview are stored
com.theta360.sample.v2.model
Package that stores Android model
com.theta360.sample.v2.network
Package storing Android HTTP communication program
com.theta360.sample.v2.view
Package that stores Android view program

Sample program

This program is a sample program that displays photos acquired from the RICOH THETA S via Wi-Fi with API v2, using mapping on an OpenGL sphere. Texture is mapped on a sphere centering on the origin point of an OpenGL coordinate system, with the user seeing a perspective display from the origin point.

Photos acquired from the RICOH THETA S are acquired at a maximum size of 5376 x 2688, and equirectangular projection is used to attach the image from camera 2 to the ends of the central image from camera 1.

In this program, the user starting view point is placed in the camera 1 image direction, and the photo image is pasted onto the sphere as a texture. The image is pasted as a texture from the xz plane upper angle pi in the -pi direction. For this reason, the camera 1 direction mentioned above is set in the x axis forward direction.

By compensating for the elevation angle (which is the slant of the camera itself against the sphere) and horizontal angle, the initial state is the state where the x axis forward direction is aligned with the horizontal direction in which camera 1 is facing.

Users can use the pinch operation to zoom in and out, and the flick operation to move the viewpoint up, down, left and right. This enables the camera FOV angle and orientation to be changed.
